form.official-title: To establish a grant program to facilitate the veterinary care of former law enforcement canines, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Honoring Police Officer and K9 Service Act of 2023.

section.header: Grant program to facilitate veterinary care for former law enforcement canines

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Attorney General shall establish a grant program to facilitate the care of former law enforcement canines (in this section referred to as the program).

In carrying out the program, the Attorney General may award a grant on a competitive basis to any entity that qualifies as a nonprofit organization under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and that the Attorney General determines has—

paragraph.text: a demonstrated history of successfully assisting the owners of former law enforcement canines with costs associated with veterinary care, medication and antibiotics, or other medical expenses for the canine; and
the capacity to record and provide a detailed accounting of the purposes for which grant amounts are expended.

subsection.text: A recipient of a grant under the program may only use grant funds to cover the costs associated with veterinary care, medication and antibiotics, or other medical expenses determined necessary by a veterinarian for the former law enforcement canine.

To be eligible for a grant under the Program, an entity shall submit to the Secretary an application at such time, in such form, and containing such information as the Attorney General determines appropriate.

paragraph.text: As a condition of receiving a grant under the program, a prospective recipient shall agree to submit to the Attorney General, on an annual basis for the duration of the project to be carried out using grant funds a report containing, with respect to the year covered by the report—

subparagraph.text: a detailed accounting of how grant funds were used; and
a proposal for how activities carried out under the project may be improved in the future.

paragraph.text: Upon receiving a report under paragraph (1), the Attorney General shall submit a copy of the report to Congress.

subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this section $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2024.

In this section, the term former law enforcement canine means a canine that has been used by a Federal, State, or local agency in the performance of law enforcement duties and that has been determined by such agency to be no longer needed for official purposes.
